TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ArgumentSemantic extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Represents the assignment semantics for properties.
Docs.remarks: This is used to flag the behavior of properties when objects are assigned, these are used by the MonoMac runtime to properly track used objects and to garbage collect them when they are no longer required.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoMac.ObjCRuntime.ArgumentSemantic Assign = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Assigning is merely a pointer copy.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoMac.ObjCRuntime.ArgumentSemantic Copy = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A copy of the object is made.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoMac.ObjCRuntime.ArgumentSemantic None = int32(-1)
.field public static literal valuetype MonoMac.ObjCRuntime.ArgumentSemantic Retain = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The object increases the reference count of the passed object.
